prs.title: 🧹hyperliquid - docs update
prs.truncated_body:
## Funding the composer address

Since the composer address needs to be funded it can be done by the user sending in funds (`$1` on `HYPE` or `USDC`) on `HyperCore` or on a `payable constructor` which makes it harder to miss but harder to find an exact value since the value of `HYPE` changes and `USDC` requires the deployer to have some `USDC` in their account and pre-approve to the undeployed a

prs.title: feat: add update timelock delay changeset for solana
prs.truncated_body:
* Adds a new timelock delay update changeset to allow updating the `min_delay` of a solana timelock instance.
* Removes unncessary code from the mcms deploy changeset in solana. It was doing a timelock ownership transfer instruction which is never accepted and thus is unnecessary. This is removed in favor of using the `TransferToMCMSWithTimelock` changeset

prs.title: Add Profiling Support for Indexer/tap-agent services
prs.truncated_body:
This PR implements comprehensive profiling support for the indexer service to help identify performance bottlenecks.

## Changes

- Added embedded continuous profiling using pprof with feature flags `profiling`
- Implemented Docker container support for profiling tools
- Added Just commands for easy profiling management
- Support for both embedded profiling and external tools:
  - Embedded

commits.message:
feat(docker): Add continuous profiling with embedded pprof and external tools

- Embedded continuous profiling using pprof in Rust code
- External tools: flamegraph, valgrind, callgrind, strace
- Docker support for all profiling methods
- Just commands for easy profiling management

Flamegraphs and profiles are saved to contrib/profiling/output.
feat(indexer): Integrate pprof tool into service binary
feat(profiling): Integrate profiling into tap-agent service
feat(profiling): Integrate pprof into tap-agent binary

refactor(profiling): extract profiling into dedicated crate

Move duplicated profiling functionality from multiple crates into a single
shared 'profiler' crate.

Key changes:
- Create new 'profiler' crate with optimized implementation
- Use AtomicU64 instead of Mutex for snapshot counter
- Add proper error handling with thiserror
- Ensure proper directory structure for profiling output
- Make profiling opt-in via a feature flag
fix(profiler): Add missing script to setup profiling
fix(docker): Fix base image for profiling
chore(cargo): Add comment to enable debug symbols
fix(profiler): Fix doctest documentation in profiler
fix(test): Disable profiling in cargo test

prs.title: op-conductor: adds supervisor connection check in health monitor
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**
Adds a simple supervisor rpc check to op-conductor health monitor to ensure the sequencer's supervisor instance is healthy. If its not healthy, interop txns will be not be included so we want to initiate a leadership transfer. We currently don't want to check for cross safe/unsafe intervals because there are valid reasons those would stall and that event we would want to continue

commits.message: op-conductor: adds supervisor healthcheck in health monitor

prs.title: cannon: Support Go 1.23
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

### Description

Support Go 1.23 by implementing a noop [eventfd2 syscall](https://www.man7.org/linux/man-pages/man2/eventfd2.2.html).  Add a new `StateVersion` `VersionMultiThreaded64_v4`(7) that enables this new functionality.  

Other changes:
- Reorganize the `testdata/example

prs.title: feat(consensus): Refactors ConsensusRegistry for validator committee rotation
prs.truncated_body:
# What ❔

Validator committee rotation is the ability to manage the validator set from the consensus registry. It was created initially to manage both attester and validator sets, but the validator committee rotation was never implemented on the server side (until now). There are two main changes:

1. Removes all attester-related code since this feature is being deprecated. (For the curious, Z

nit, but it is easy to imagine an operator putting in a value that is not a power of two, which would lead to fd_buf_shred_map_footprint being 0.

prs.title: Feat: state verifier
prs.truncated_body:
This PR implements a module that allows to verify that some `storage values` were indeed present on a particular `block height` in the chain.

The idea is the similar how Neutron's KV ICQ works: each `StorageValue` in Cosmos SDK is stored in [KV-IAVL storage](https://github.com/cosmos/iavl).
And to be more precise it's stored in a structure called [`MerkleTree`](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos

reuse VerifyStorageValue in ICQ and state_verifier

prs.title: fix(lazer/solana): add mut annotation on treasury account
prs.truncated_body:
## Rationale

The lack of mut annotation is not causing any security risk (because if you pass it as readable it'll fail later when being used as writable). However, it breaks downstream users who rely on the published lib crate of the contract when making CPI to the contract.

## How has this been tested?

- [x] Manually tested the code: the example anchor contract passes tests with this ch

prs.title: feat(entropy): Event V2 spec
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Add a new set of EntropyEvents to improve on the previous spec. Specifically, add indexing for the salient attributes, stop depending on struct definitions (which, if changed, break the event signature), and add dummy bytes for future extensibility.

In the process, I have omitted events for code paths that we are going to kill off (like the old pull flow).

## How has this been

prs.title: feat(apps/hermes): add connection timeout for SSE & WebSocket connections
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

- Added a 24-hour connection timeout for SSE endpoint
- Added a 24-hour connection timeout for WS endpoint
- Each client connection will automatically disconnect after 24 hours of continuous connection, with a proper error message sent before closing.

## Rationale

- Prevents resource leaks from indefinite connections
- Ensures proper cleanup of long-running connections
- Ea

feat(ws): replace connection timeout with connection deadline for improved WebSocket management
fix(ws): simplify return statement in WebSocket close handling

feat(sse): update maximum connection duration for SSE streams to 24 hours
refactor(sse): clone state and price_ids for use inside async block
refactor(sse): replace connection deadline with start time for SSE stream duration check
chore: bump version to 0.8.6 in Cargo files

prs.title: fix: safe (or other sca) gas estimates
prs.truncated_body: most (if not all) SCA implementations use more than the gas allocated for a simple `.transfer()`. this means that when interacting with a contract that utilises `.transfer()`, that function will fail with an `out of gas` error by default. to avoid this, we can generate an access list of storage slots accessed during the transaction, which then pays for the cold gas of any storage slot at the start

commits.message: fix: safe (or other sca) gas estimates
add fix for ambire and revert chains
update error message for reth workaround

prs.title: cmd/rofl/machine: Rename terminate/cancel -> stop/remove
prs.truncated_body:
This PR renames:
1. `oasis rofl machine terminate` -> `oasis rofl machine stop`
2. `oasis rofl machine cancel` -> `oasis rofl machine remove`

It keeps old "terminate" and "cancel" subcommands as aliases.

## Rationale

1. The "terminate" term may also associate with "terminate your subscription", which is not the case. The "stop" term is also more consistent with Docker's "start/stop/rest

[tmpnet] Delegate writing of the flag file to the runtime

prs.title: Add git to nix packages
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

After running `nix develop` and then `./scripts/run_task build` I ran into:
```
$ ./scripts/run_task.sh build
task: [build] ./scripts/build.sh
error: tool 'git' not found
task: Failed to run task "build": exit status 1
```

After adding `git` to the required packages and re-running `nix develop` and then `./scripts/run_task build`, the build succeeded withou

prs.title: fix: add yield token incident claim method type back
prs.truncated_body:
Add yield token incident claim method type back and mark it as deprecated

## Description

Removed enum value made getProductType calls fail because of claim method being `1` in contract storage on mainnet. Adding it back to address the issue.

## Deployment

:warning:  If there's nothing failing on-chain we may keep this for the next release, otherwise we may consider a hotfix.

## Test

commits.message: fix: add yield token incident claim method type back to the enum and mark as deprecated

prs.title: fix: renewal of a cover that was bought with limitOrders
prs.truncated_body:
Two issues we currently have:
- When there is an order with initial cover buy and renewals, we don't pass an original cover ID when renewing, so the cover doesn't get edited, and we would have double covers for some period. The second renewal would fail because we have a check for the expiration by the initial cover ID that doesn't have a new cover linked to it, and limit order contract would see

commits.message: fix: renewal not cover editing but creating new cover without expiring the old one
fix: fix `isNewCover` conditional check in limit orders

prs.title: fix: Flaky Jumbo transactions tests
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
The `prepareFakeUpgrade` was left when the jumbo transaction was disabled, but we do not need it anymore. The fake upgrade operation sometimes fails (flaky) since it cannot find the `0.0.150` file, thus we need to remove it to fix the pipeline.

commits.message:
fix: flaky tests

prs.title: Fix `NullPointerException` on get token treasury account (0.128)
prs.truncated_body: Cherry-pick from #11053

commits.message:
Fix `NullPointerException` on get token treasury account (#11053)

This PR changes the way the token treasury and auto renew accounts are added to the state. Now they are added only with account nums instead of account aliases. This is done in order to be compatible and in sync with the hedera.app dependency and the consensus node.

---------

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>

prs.title: Fix `NullPointerException` on get token treasury account
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
This PR changes the way the token treasury and auto renew accounts are added to the state. Now they are added only with account nums instead of account aliases. This is done in order to be compatible and in sync with the hedera.app dependency and the consensus node.

This will be optimized in [#10807](https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-mirror-node/issues/10807).

Fixes #11

commits.message:
Fix NullPointerException on get token treasury account

Signed-off-by: Bilyana Gospodinova <bilyana.gospodinova14@gmail.com>

prs.title: Gatekeeper contract implementation
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

This PR brings the following changes:

- Introduction of the Gatekeeper smart contract, which is responsible for validating if the given user should be allowed to lock the given amount of tokens at a given point in time.
- Modifies the Hydro contract to be able to utilize the Gatekeeper. If specified in the Hydro instantiate message, Gatekeeper will be instantiated as well. Th

commits.message: fixed clippy errors originating from newer version of clippy
Disallow removing last admin and add test

prs.title: feat(ethexe/contracts): add parsing of ethereum events and replies from sails framework
prs.truncated_body:
Resolves #4338

Also see:
- gear-tech/sails#844
- gear-tech/sails#859

commits.message: feat(ethexe/contracts): add parsing ethereum events from sails framework
add support for any network for deployment, replace `Strings` from OpenZeppelin with `vm.toString`
use `RETURN` opcode in `Mirror::fallback` to pass `messageId` to return data
add support for handling replies from sails
add proper upgrades handling for small clones
add dev comments to Clones and ClonesSmall
add docs to MirrorProxy and MirrorProxySmall
revert error handling, use early return in _tryParseAndEmitSailsEvent
